parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Feminine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
From phroneo; mental action or activity, i.e. Intellectual or moral insight.
